column2: A sequence of experiments where each experiment has exactly two possible outcomes. The probability of success is constant, and the experiments are independent.
When sampling without replacement, trials can be considered independent if the sample size is less than 10% of the population.
A model appropriate for a random variable that counts the number of trials until the first success in a series of Bernoulli trials.
A model appropriate for a random variable that counts the number of successes in a fixed number of Bernoulli trials.
For a Normal model to approximate a Binomial model well, at least 10 successes and 10 failures are expected.
The results of a study are considered statistically significant if the probability that they occurred by chance is very low.
